name: Nimit Aggarwal
aboutText:
Hello! I am working with BrowserStack as a Senior Software Engineer. I completed B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering in 2018.

Strong data structures, algorithms and problem-solving skills, fast learner, technology enthusiast, impact-oriented.
I recently got a Mobile Web specialist certification from Google and has also completed Udacity's Mobile Web specialist Nanodegree.

I have been an SDE intern and TA in Algo at Coding Blocks. I have also completed Udacity's Android Developer, Nanodegree by Google. I've completed Machine Learning and Algorithm Analysis and Design on Coursera.

I am driven by challenging, fast-paced, exciting, and educational environments. My areas of interest include web and mobile application development.

experience.name: BrowserStack
experience.description:
Part of Local Team. Local Testing allows you to test your private and internal servers, alongside public URLs, using the BrowserStack cloud, which has support for firewalls, proxies and Active Directory. Local Testing handles around 1 million sessions per day. Primarily works in Node JS
• Designed and Defined the metrics for the performance of the system and put them in place.
• Successful in improving the performance of the system by ~30%
• Moved all the components to the latest versions(Removed Tech debt)
• Internal tools and documentation to reduce customer resolution time by ~50%

experience.name: BrowserStack
experience.description:
Part of Local Team. Local Testing allows you to test your private and internal servers, alongside public URLs, using the BrowserStack cloud, which has support for firewalls, proxies and Active Directory. Local Testing handles around 1 million sessions per day
• Helped put metrics in place for the Stability of the system.
• Fixed the stability of the system to 99.99 %
• Capacity planning of the whole system, to know when to scale up
• Solved various ops issues and various client issues.

experience.name: Google Code-in
experience.description: Google Code-in is a contest to introduce pre-university students (ages 13-17) to open source software development

experience.name: Coding Block
experience.description: Helping 60 plus students with Data Structures and Algorithms at Algo++

journeySteps.heading: 2014 college freshman year and C++
journeySteps.description: Freshman year of college in Computer Science at MAIT, Delhi. Began with basics of C++. Started doing some questions online as well. But nothing Serioud

journeySteps.heading: Learned Android
journeySteps.description: There was a big learning curve here. I directly started with Android so had to cope with Learning Java as well. Had got comfortable in C++ though

journeySteps.heading: Google and Udacity Scholarship
journeySteps.description: Had applied for it, and was actually able to clear the test and the interview. Passionately followed Android and Completed Android Developer NanoDegree

journeySteps.heading: Some Internships
journeySteps.description: After completing the Nanodegree I did couple of internships in Android. Then followed it up with Teaching Assistant @Coding Blocks in Algo++. Course for advanced Data Structure and Algorithms

journeySteps.heading: Learned Node.JS!
journeySteps.description: After mobile development it was time to move into the world of web. I started with Node and really loved this runtime version of JS.

journeySteps.heading: Completed College 2018 and Joined BrowserStack!
journeySteps.description: Finally got my bachelors degree with 78%. Just after graduating I joined BrowserStack as Software Engineer. Also shifted to Mumbai for the job

journeySteps.heading: Google Certified Mobile Web Specialist
journeySteps.description: While working I was able to squeeze enough time to Complete Mobile Web Specialist Nanodegree and then go ahead and also get a Google Certification for the same. This all hone me improve my frontend skills.
